availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. New York native. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Postmaster in Havilandsville from 1865 to 1866.

ab.bibl: William Henry Perrin, ed., History of Bourbon, Scott, and Nicholas Counties, Kentucky (Chicago, IL: O. L. Baskin and Company, 1882), p. 699. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 111. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Richland District, p. 10. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Harrison County, KY, May 1863, p. 198, (Accessed via ancestry.com). Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Volume 28, p. 90, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
